Container.Name: Meshcentral
Container.Overview:
MeshCentral is a full computer management web site. With MeshCentral, you can run your own web server to remotely manage and control computers on a local network or anywhere on the internet. Once you get the server started, create device group and download and install an agent on each computer you want to manage. A minute later, the new computer will show up on the web site and you can take control of it. MeshCentral includes full web-based remote desktop, terminal and file management capability.
For more information, visit https://meshcentral.com/ https://github.com/Ylianst/MeshCentral
While easier to setup and get up and running, you should still peer through the very informative official guides: https://meshcentral.com/info/docs/MeshCentral2InstallGuide.pdf https://meshcentral.com/info/docs/MeshCentral2UserGuide.pdf

Config.Name: Data Path
Config.Description: config.json and other important files live here. A must for data persistence

Config.Name: User File Path
Config.Description: where file uploads for users live

Config.Name: Port
Config.Description: MeshCentral where meshcentral shall be reached

Config.Name: Allow new accounts
Config.Description: set to false if you want disable self-service creation of new accounts besides the first (admin)

Config.Name: Reverse Proxy IP
Config.Description: set to your reverse proxy IP if you want to put meshcentral behind a reverse proxy, else set fo false

Config.Name: Reverse Proxy Port
Config.Description: The port of the reverse proxy server

Config.Name: Use IFRAME
Config.Description: set to true if you wish to enable iframe support

Config.Name: Use WEBRTC
Config.Description: set to true to enable WebRTC - per documentation it is not officially released with meshcentral, but is solid enough to work with. Use with caution

Config.Name: Server Title
Config.Description: The Server Title. This is only informational text.

Config.Name: Servername
Config.Description: The subtitle or the name of the server. This is only informational text.

Config.Name: FORCE_CREATE_CONFIG
Config.Description: Force the recreation of the config file, the old one will be deleted
